content.question: An ideal gas is taken through an isobaric compression, as shown in the pressure-volume diagram. Which of the following claims is correct about the direction of the energy transfer, if any, between the gas and its surroundings during this process?

choices.label: Heat energy is transferred from the surroundings to the gas.
Heat energy is transferred from the gas to the surroundings.
There is no transfer of heat energy.
It cannot be determined without knowing whether the gas is insulated.

content.answer: Heat energy is transferred from the gas to the surroundings.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
